About Us | Cross Creek Country Club Tee Times: 336-789-5131 | Office: 336-789-5193 info@crosscreekcc.com Facebook Instagram TikTok YouTube Facebook Instagram TikTok YouTube Golf Course Course Info Dress Code Rates Club Calendar Golf Instruction Golf 101 Ladies’ Golf Association (LGA) Men’s Golf Association (MGA) Surry County Jr. Championship Membership Membership Request Membership Types Member Login Amenities Dining Tennis Swimming Summer Camp Social Activities Events Special Events Weddings & Receptions Golf Outings Grand Ballroom Banquet Information Event Request Club News Contact Us About Us Directions Privacy Policy Covid-19 Awareness Select Page Our History Cross Creek Country Club is celebrating more than fifty years of providing fine dining and recreation to its members. Situated at the foot of the majestic Blue Ridge Mountains, the club has been in operation since 1973. “The landscape here is truly breath taking, and it provides our members with a quiet atmosphere for enjoying their time spent with friends and family,” said Shannon Waters, General Manager of Cross Creek. “We offer a semi-private 18-hole golf course which accommodates members and their guests as well as daily fee golfers. Cross Creek is also known for fine cuisine, social activities, charity events, and a variety of athletic facilities, including swimming and tennis.” The Cross Creek property was originally a working farm owned by H.O. Woltz, Sr. The farm produced tobacco and corn and raised beef cattle. At one time it also included a commercial flower growing operation which supplied gladiola, jonquil, and tulips to wholesalers throughout the east coast. Later, after acquiring additional acreage adjacent to the farm, Mr. Woltz envisioned that the site would provide a beautiful setting for a first-class country club and golf course. Woltz believed such a club would have a positive economic impact on Mt. Airy, while enhancing quality of life for residents. Woltz, along with fellow investors Richard Vaughn, Zack Blackmon, Sr., Lindsay Holcomb, Jr., Smith Holcomb, Kilbourn Henry, Ed Crossingham, and Don Porter contracted with Joseph Lee, a well known and highly respected golf course architect to help them design and develop the new country club. The consulting firm of Martini and Associates was also brought in to assist with design of the club and surrounding residential developments. Cross Creek Country Club officially opened in 1973 featuring a 6,800-yard golf course designed by Joe Lee. The clubhouse was completely renovated in 2001 to include a well-appointed interior and Grand Ballroom which has become the centerpiece of the region’s social scene. Improvements were made to the golf course in 2005 under the guidance of Greensboro-based architect Kris Spence, and a three-season pavilion was added in 2007 which has since become a popular venue for dining, dancing, parties, and musical entertainment. The improvements were noted by North Carolina Business magazine who named Cross Creek one of the top 100 golf courses in the State. In October of 2020, Skip and Cathy Eckenrod, former owners of Interlam Inc., a manufacturer of architectural wall panels and design elements, purchased Cross Creek Country Club. Skip and Cathy are making ongoing significant investments for capital improvements, renovations and upgrades, including a new roof for the clubhouse and pool. The club’s in-house restaurant has also been renovated and renamed ‘The Sunset Grille’.” The Club’s GM brought in PGA Head Golf Professional, Kent Shumate, as well as Chef Josh Greenberg. Kent Shumate joined the club from Olde Beau Resort & Golf Club. Previously, he served twenty-four years at Mount Airy Country Club as the PGA Head Golf Professional. Chef Greenberg most recently worked in South Florida where he also received formal training at Le Cordon Bleu in Miami and specialized in fresh seafood dishes. And while there have been many changes and improvements, the Eckenrods and their team have continued the traditions of fine dining and recreational excellence that Cross Creek Country Club has been known for. Skip and Cathy have also kept alive the dream of H.O. Woltz who envisioned a first-class Country Club that enhances the community, supports economic growth, and brings enjoyment to the residents of Mount Airy, Surry County, and surrounding areas. Today Cross Creek Country Club has over 300 members, and provides a venue for unique Member Events, high school proms, reunions, community banquets, corporate retreats and meetings, charity events, weddings, and receptions. Cross Creek Country Club is located at 1129 Greenhill Road in Mount Airy, North Carolina. For more information, call (336) 789-5193. About Us Cross Creek Country Club is nestled at the base of the Blue Ridge Mountains, in Mount Airy, NC. This semi-private golf club offers an amazing 18-hole golf course and a variety of sports, social, and dining activities for both members and daily fee golfers . Enjoy southern hospitality at its best! Location 1129 Greenhill Road Mount Airy, NC 27030 TEL : (336) 789-5193 Powered by foreUP

About Us – Cross Creek CDD Skip to content Information Calendar Documents Links Contact Information Calendar Documents Links Contact About Us The University Park Recreation District was formed by Manatee County on August 2, 2018 to purchase, operate and maintain the University Park Country Club and its related facilities along with +/- 100 acres of conservation and open space land in the District. Establishment Manatee County formed the University Park Recreation District via Ordinance 18-29 pursuant to Chapter 418, F.S. based on a petition signed by over 80% of District residents requesting the formation of the District. Ordinance 18-29, amended by Ordinance 23-95 PDF | RTF Legal Description PDF | RTF District Boundaries Map PDF | RTF Mission, Vision, Values Our Mission: Deliver to members and guests ever evolving lifestyle experiences that are engaging and inclusive by providing exemplary service, facilities and amenities. Our Vision: To be the preeminent gathering place for members and guests to meet, socialize and enjoy lifestyle  opportunities that exceed their expectations in a modern club environment, that also enhances our residential community. Our Core Values: Values that are truly important direct the decision we make, define our character, and preserve what is special about our Club. They are: Integrity, Trust & Mutual Respect – Acting ethically in the best interests of our members, staff and community. Quality – Striving to be the best that can be in all that we do. Fiscal Responsibility and Transparency – Openly communicating our financial position and ensuring that operating budgets and reserves are sufficient to meet the current and future needs of the Club. Environmental stewardship – Commitment to preserving our natural landscape and considering the environmental impact of our decisions. Contact Information District Manager & Registered Agent Venessa Ripoll 3501 Quadrangle Blvd., Suite 270 Orlando FL 32817 ripollv@pfm.com Phone: (407) 723-5900 District Records Custodian 3501 Quadrangle Blvd., Suite 270 Orlando FL 32817 recordrequest@pfm.com Phone: (407) 723-5900 Community Resources Clerk of Court County Government Property Appraiser School Board Supervisor of Elections Tax Collector Explore Cross Creek CDD Information Calendar Documents Links Contact Privacy Policy* Under Florida law, e-mail addresses provided to local governments, including the Cross Creek CDD , are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing at https://www.crosscreekcdd.org

Golf Course – Cross Creek Atlanta AMENITIES Cafe Fitness Center Golf Course Pools Tennis Courts ASSOCIATION Board History Management BUYERS Buyers Info Insurance Leasing Moving In RESIDENT LIFE Events HOA Committees Maintenance Parking Pets Reporting Issues Safety Privacy Policy Terms & Conditions Trash PORTAL LOG IN Golf Course Located at the very pulse  of Atlanta’s prestigious northside, Cross Creek Golf Club has something to offer for golfers of all ages. The combination of gently rolling land, ponds , grass mounds and woods makes this a challenging 2,000 yard par 54 course, enjoyable for players of all ability levels. With the short game compromising as much as 65% of a golfer’s round, why not sharpen those areas on a golf course designed for that very purpose? Seniors, ladies and juniors all find our course to be a fun place to enjoy the game. We are family friendly and the pace of play is quick so it doesn’t take 5 hours to play a round!  Cross Creek is the perfect place to relax and enjoy a recreational round or for hosting a business or charity event. Come enjoy some laid back,  good ole southern hospitality in a beautiful setting with a little golf to boot. Memberships are available. Residents enjoy a discounted rate for greens fees and memberships.  Contact the pro-shop at 404-352-5612 or email smartin@hoadv.com for more information. AMENITIES Cross Creek Cafe Fitness Center Golf Course Pools Tennis Courts Privacy Policy Terms & Conditions Cross Creek Condominiums 1221 Cross Creek Parkway Atlanta, Georgia 30327 404-351-7600

He grew up in the Grand Traverse area, and has a deep love for the region's lakes, rivers, forests, and all of the creatures in them. Matt has a B.F.A. in Film and Television from the Savannah College of Art and Design. Joe Torrence, Media Specialist Email Joe Joe is responsible for day-to-day operations and management of digital media at Traverse Area Community Media and provides assistance for volunteer productions. Joe holds a degree in Television and Digital Media Production from Ferris State University. Rob Astor, Technology Director Email Rob Rob is a computer programmer responsible for database design and management, system integration, and the development of new user interfaces. Rob provides technology support for Traverse Area Community Media. He earned a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from Michigan State University and is a returned Peace Corps volunteer. Jim Muratzki, Support Specialist Email Jim Jim provides support and development for LIAA's web applications. He once earned two B.S. degrees from Michigan State University, one in geography and one in anthropology.
